// bootCalback calls at before elFinder boot up 
,bootCallback : function(fm, extraObj) {
    /* any bind functions etc. */
    fm.bind('init', function() {
        // any your code
    });
    // for example set document.title dynamically.
    var title = document.title;
    fm.bind('open', function() {
        var path = '',
            cwd  = fm.cwd();
        if (cwd) {
            path = fm.path(cwd.hash) || null;
        }
        document.title = path? path + ':' + title : title;
    }).bind('destroy', function() {
        document.title = title;
    });
    // maximize editor dialog
    fm.bind('dialogopened', function(e) {
        var dialog = e.data.dialog;
        if (dialog.hasClass('elfinder-dialog-edit')) {
            dialog.find('.elfinder-titlebar-button.elfinder-titlebar-full').trigger('mousedown');

elFinderVolumeTrashMySQL
```php
<?php
/**
elFinder driver for trash bin at local filesystem.
 *

@author NaokiSawada
 /
class elFinderVolumeTrashMySQL extends elFinderVolumeMySQL
{
    /

Driver id
Must be started from letter and contains [a-z0-9]
Used as part of volume id.
 *
@var string
 **/
protected $driverId = 'tm';

public function __construct()
{
    parent::__construct();
    // original option of the Trash
    $this->options['lockEverything'] = false; // Lock all items in the trash to disable delete, move, rename.
// common options as the volume driver
$this->options['alias'] = 'Trash';
$this->options['quarantine'] = '';
$this->options['rootCssClass'] = 'elfinder-navbar-root-trash';
$this->options['copyOverwrite'] = false;
$this->options['uiCmdMap'] = array('paste' => 'hidden', 'mkdir' => 'hidden', 'copy' => 'restore');
$this->options['disabled'] = array('archive', 'duplicate', 'edit', 'extract', 'mkfile', 'places', 'put', 'rename', 'resize', 'upload');

}
public function mount(array $opts)
{
    if ($this->options['lockEverything']) {
        if (!is_array($opts['attributes'])) {
            $opts['attributes'] = array();
        }
        $attr = array(
            'pattern' => '/./',
            'locked' => true,
        );
        array_unshift($opts['attributes'], $attr);
    }
    // force set copyJoin to true
    $opts['copyJoin'] = true;
return parent::mount($opts);

}
}

elFinder::$netDrivers['ftp'] = 'FTP';
// ===============================================
/
 * Simple function to demonstrate how to control file access using "accessControl" callback.
 * This method will disable accessing files/folders starting from '.' (dot)
 *
 * @param  string    $attr    attribute name (read|write|locked|hidden)
 * @param  string    $path    absolute file path
 * @param  string    $data    value of volume option accessControlData
 * @param  object    $volume  elFinder volume driver object
 * @param  bool|null $isDir   path is directory (true: directory, false: file, null: unknown)
 * @param  string    $relpath file path relative to volume root directory started with directory separator
 * @return bool|null
 /
function access($attr, $path, $data, $volume, $isDir, $relpath) {
    static $target;
    if (!$target && $volume->id() === 'l1_') {
        $target = $volume->getHash('.tmb');
    }
    $show = $_REQUEST['cmd'] === 'open' && isset($_REQUEST['target']) && $_REQUEST['target'] === $target;
    $basename = basename($path);
    return !$show && $basename[0] === '.'        // if file/folder begins with '.' (dot)
             && strlen($relpath) !== 1           // but with out volume root
        ? !($attr == 'read' || $attr == 'write') // set read+write to false, other (locked+hidden) set to true
        :  null;                                 // else elFinder decide it itself
}
// Documentation for connector options:
// https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/wiki/Connector-configuration-options
$opts = array(
    'debug' => true,
    'roots' => array(
        // Items volume
        array(
            'driver'        => 'LocalFileSystem',           // driver for accessing file system (REQUIRED)
            'path'          => '../files/',                 // path to files (REQUIRED)
            'URL'           => dirname($_SERVER['PHP_SELF']) . '/../files/', // URL to files (REQUIRED)
            'trashHash'     => 't1_Lw',                     // elFinder's hash of trash folder
            'winHashFix'    => DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR !== '/', // to make hash same to Linux one on windows too
            'uploadDeny'    => array('all'),                // All Mimetypes not allowed to upload
            'uploadAllow'   => array('image', 'text/plain', 'application/zip'),// Mimetype image and text/plain allowed to upload
            'uploadOrder'   => array('deny', 'allow'),      // allowed Mimetype image and text/plain only
            'accessControl' => 'access'                     // disable and hide dot starting files (OPTIONAL)
        ),
        // Trash volume
        array(
            'id'            => '1',
            'driver'        => 'Trash',
            'path'          => '../files/.trash/',
            'tmbURL'        => dirname($_SERVER['PHP_SELF']) . '/../files/.trash/.tmb/',
            'winHashFix'    => DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR !== '/', // to make hash same to Linux one on windows too
            'uploadDeny'    => array('all'),                // Recomend the same settings as the original volume that uses the trash
            'uploadAllow'   => array('image', 'text/plain', 'application/zip'),// Same as above
            'uploadOrder'   => array('deny', 'allow'),      // Same as above
            'accessControl' => 'access',                    // Same as above
        )
    )
);
// run elFinder
$connector = new elFinderConnector(new elFinder($opts));
$connector->run();

On the Windows server, since the communication time with the outside is included in PHP execution time, it may be time out. Please retry with change the "_fopen ()" function of "elFinderVolumeFTP.class.php L. 1046" as follows.
```php
    protected function _fopen($path, $mode='rb') {
        // try ftp stream wrapper
        if ($this->options['mode'] === 'passive' && ini_get('allow_url_fopen')) {
            $url = ($this->isFTPS? 'ftps' : 'ftp').'://'.$this->options['user'].':'.$this->options['pass'].'@'.$this->options['host'].':'.$this->options['port'].$path;
            if (strtolower($mode[0]) === 'w') {
                $context = stream_context_create(array('ftp' => array('overwrite' => true)));
                $fp = fopen($url, $mode, false, $context);
            } else {
                $fp = fopen($url, $mode);
            }
            if ($fp) {
                return $fp;
            }
        }
    if ($this->tmp) {
        $local = $this->getTempFile($path);
        $fp = fopen($local, 'wb');
        $ret = ftp_nb_fget($this->connect, $fp, $path, FTP_BINARY);
        while ($ret === FTP_MOREDATA) {
            elFinder::extendTimeLimit();
            $ret = ftp_nb_continue($this->connect);
        }
        if ($ret === FTP_FINISHED) {
            return $fp;
        }
        fclose($fp);
        is_file($local) && unlink($local);
    }

    return false;
}

    protected function _fopen($path, $mode='rb') {
        // try ftp stream wrapper

            $url = ($this->isFTPS? 'ftps' : 'ftp').'://'.$this->options['user'].':'.$this->options['pass'].'@'.$this->options['host'].':'.$this->options['port'].$path;

            }

    if ($this->tmp) {

php
class elFinderPluginMyNormalizer extends elFinderPluginNormalizer
{
    protected function normalize($str, $opts) {
        $str = parent::normalize($str, $opts);
        if (!empty($opts['ext_lowercase'])) {
            $ext = substr($str,strripos($str, '.') + 1);
            if (function_exists('mb_strtolower')) {
                $ext = mb_strtolower($ext, 'UTF-8');
            } else {
                $ext = strtolower($ext);
            }
            $str = substr($str,0,strripos($str, '.')+1).$ext;
        }
        return $str;
    }
}

        });
    }

I done in f05b84b0a6166fce2a55a2722b23ee6a8566088c .. @yuchting The best solution to this problem is to use PHP compiled with 64 bit. However, even with the current code, file size of 4 GB or less can be acquired correctly in many environments. I added this option for environments that can not handle files larger than 4GB or 2GB correctly. For example, to realize the same thing as this PR, specify the option as follows.
```php
$opts = array(
    'roots'  => array(
        array(
            'driver' => 'LocalFileSystem',
            'path'   => '/path/to/files/',
            'statCorrector' => function (&$stat, $path, $statOwner, $volumeDriveInstance) {
                if (isset($stat['size']) && $stat['mime'] !== 'directory') {
                    if ($stat['size'] == '0') {
                        // filesize problem for file larger than 4GB ( testing in PHP Version 5.4.16)
                        // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6482211/php-filesize-over-4gb
                        $stat['size'] = trim(shell_exec('stat -c %s '.escapeshellarg($path)));
                    }
                if ($stat['ts'] === false){
                    // sometime filemtime will failed to return false
                    $stat['ts'] = (int)trim(shell_exec('stat -c %Y '.escapeshellarg($path)));
                }
            }
        }
    )
)

);
// run elFinder
$connector = new elFinderConnector(new elFinder($opts));
$connector->run();

Later I will post a sample with the file type "*.uri".. This is example to show YouTube player.


elFinder client option bootCallback
```javascript
bootCallback : function(fm, extraObj) {
    fm.commands.quicklook.plugins.unshift(
        function(ql) {
            "use strict";
            var mime = 'text/uri-list',
                fm = ql.fm,
                preview = ql.preview,
                loading = $(' '+fm.i18n('nowLoading')+'');
            preview.on(ql.evUpdate, function(e) {
                var file = e.file, jqxhr;
            if ((file.mime === mime || (file.mime === 'text/plain' && file.name.match(/\.uri$/i))) && (file.mediaUrl || (!ql.options.getSizeMax || file.size <= ql.options.getSizeMax))) {
                if (typeof file.mediaUrl !== 'undefined') {
                    if (file.mediaUrl) {
                        e.stopImmediatePropagation();
                        loading.appendTo(ql.info.find('.elfinder-quicklook-info'));
                        $('<iframe style="width:100%;height:100%;" src="'+file.mediaUrl+'" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen></iframe>')
                            .on('load', function() {
                                loading.remove();
                                ql.hideinfo();
                            })
                            .appendTo(preview);
                    }
                } else {
                    e.stopImmediatePropagation();
                    loading.appendTo(ql.info.find('.elfinder-quicklook-info'));

                    // stop loading on change file if not loaded yet
                    preview.one('change', function() {
                        jqxhr.state() == 'pending' && jqxhr.reject();
                    }).addClass('elfinder-overflow-auto');

                    jqxhr = fm.request({
                        data           : {cmd : 'get', target : file.hash, conv : 1, _t : file.ts},
                        options        : {type: 'get', cache : true},
                        preventDefault : true
                    })
                    .done(function(data) {
                        var m;
                        if (m = data.content.match(/(?:^\s*)(https:\/\/www\.youtube\.com\/embed\/[a-z0-9_-]+)(?:\s*$)/i)) {
                            file.mediaUrl = m[1];
                        } else {
                            file.mediaUrl = '';
                        }
                        fm.updateCache({
                            files: [file]
                        });
                    })
                    .fail(function() {
                        file.mediaUrl = '';
                    })
                    .always(function() {
                        preview.trigger({
                            type: ql.evUpdate,
                            file: file,
                            forceUpdate: true
                        });
                    });
                }
            }
        });
    }
);

}
```

Thanks!. @aminbaik Decompressing the zip archive uses the shell command on the server or PHP's ZipArchive class. Basically, if a file containing a file name other than UTF-8 is included, you need to set your own archiver settings.
Do you have a alternate code or command setting that can handle the character encoding you use?. If you have functions yourCustomCompressor() / yourCustomDecompressor() that you process with PHP it looks like this.
```php
<?php
function yourCustomCompressor($workingDir, $files, $zipFilename) {
    // see elFinderVolumeDriver::zipArchiveZip()
}
function yourCustomDecompressor($zipPath, $toDir) {
    // see elFinderVolumeDriver::zipArchiveUnzip()
}
$opts = array(
    'roots' => array(
        'driver' => 'LocalFileSystem',
        'path'   => '/path/to/files/',
        'archivers' => array(
            'create' => array(
                'application/zip' => array(
                    'cmd' => 'phpfunction',
                    'argc' => 'yourCustomCompressor',
                    'ext' => 'zip'
                )
            ),
            'extract' => array(
                'application/zip' => array(
                    'cmd' => 'phpfunction',
                    'argc' => 'yourCustomDecompressor',
                    'ext' => 'zip'
                )
            )
        )
    )
);
// run elFinder
$connector = new elFinderConnector(new elFinder($opts));
$connector->run();
```. @aminbaik This is the connector to which elFinder client is connected. For default configuration it is "php/connector.minimal.php".. @mtran0011 Thank you for accurate PR. 👍 . @alexandrovsergii Please set commandsOptions.search.searchTypes to empty and hide it in the style sheet.

``. @iambudi You can use an option [accessControl`](https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/wiki/Connector-configuration-options-2.1#accesscontrol) of volume roots options.
For example, the function for A can be written as
``php
/**
 * Simple function to demonstrate how to control file access using "accessControl" callback.
 * This method will disable accessing files/folders starting from '.' (dot)
 *
 * @param  string    $attr    attribute name (read|write|locked|hidden)
 * @param  string    $path    absolute file path
 * @param  string    $data    value of volume optionaccessControlData`
 * @param  object    $volume  elFinder volume driver object
 * @param  bool|null $isDir   path is directory (true: directory, false: file, null: unknown)
 * @param  string    $relpath file path relative to volume root directory started with directory separator
 * @return bool|null
 **/
function accessForA($attr, $path, $data, $volume, $isDir, $relpath) {
    static $regpat;
    if (!$regpat) {
        $regpat = <<<'EOP'
~^
    Documents(
        /   # directory
        |
        /.+ # all of items
    )
    |
    Pictures(
        /   # directory
        |
        /
        (
            [^/]+   # files
            |
            Events  # Pictures/Events
            (
                /   # directory
                |
                /[^/]+   # files
                |
                /
                (
                    (
                        School  # Pictures/Events/School
                        |
                        Others  # Pictures/Events/Others
                    )
                    (
                        /   # directory
                        |
                        /[^/]+   # files
                    )
                )
            )
            |
            Design  # Pictures/Design
            (
                /   # directory
                |
                /.+   # all of items
            )
        )
    )
$~x
EOP;
    }
$test = trim($relpath, '/');
if ($isDir) {
    $test .= '/';
}

if (!preg_match($regpat, $test)) {
    // set read+write to false, other (locked+hidden) set to true
    return !($attr === 'read' || $attr === 'write');
}

$basename = basename($path);
return $basename[0] === '.'                  // if file/folder begins with '.' (dot)
         && strlen($relpath) !== 1           // but with out volume root
    ? !($attr == 'read' || $attr == 'write') // set read+write to false, other (locked+hidden) set to true
    :  null;                                 // else elFinder decide it itself

}
```. @ahrasis Add the following settings to the client options.

https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=label%3Ahowto+upload+bind. @toastbrotch One way to do this is to extend the elFinderVolumeLocalFileSystem class. This example is simple. Actually it may be necessary to prevent degradation in performance by caching dim in some way.

php
class elFinderVolumeMyLocalFileSystem extends elFinderVolumeLocalFileSystem
{
    protected function stat($path) {
        $file = parent::stat($path);
        if ($file) {
            $dim = $this->_dimensions($this->convEncIn($path, true), $file['mime']);
            if ($dim) {
                $file['dim'] = $dim;
            }
        }
        return $file;
    }
}

php
'bind' => array(
    'upload.presave' => array(
        function($thash, $name, $src, $elfinder, $volume) {
            $imageType = null;
            $srcImgInfo = null;
            if (extension_loaded('fileinfo') && function_exists('mime_content_type')) {
                $mime = mime_content_type($src);
                if (substr($mime, 0, 5) !== 'image') {
                    return false;
                }
            }
            if (extension_loaded('exif') && function_exists('exif_imagetype')) {
                $imageType = exif_imagetype($src);
                if ($imageType === false) {
                    return false;
                }
            } else {
                $srcImgInfo = getimagesize($src);
                if ($srcImgInfo === false) {
                    return false;
                }
            }
            if ($srcImgInfo === null) {
                $srcImgInfo = getimagesize($src);
            }
            if ($srcImgInfo) {
                if ($srcImgInfo[0] < 200 && $srcImgInfo[1] < 250) {
                    return array('error' => array(elFinder::ERROR_UPLOAD_FILE, $name, 'The image is too small to be uploaded.'));
                }
            }
        }
    )

Thanks!. @KlausHB There are many costs involved in calculating the total size of the files contained in a folder. It is not realistic to always calculate their size, especially if the folder contains so many files and descendant folders. Therefore, elFinder is designed to calculate only when the user needs it. Please refer to the following video.

If you want to always show the total folder size, you need to create your own driver that includes the folder size in the file information.. @adolforo That is probably the function of the drag-out works and the server is getting through the URL. The server seems to be unable to read for its URL.

Well, let's talk about the behavior of elFinder when dragging out.
If you start dragging while holding down the Alt key, elFinder starts HTML 5 specification dragging. In the drag data, the URL of the item is set, so if you drop it into elFinder, the content will be retrieved from the URL on the web server side and the file will be saved.
Therefore, to save content successfully, you need to configure the web server to allow the web server to retrieve data using the URL pointed to by the item in elFinder. In a typical configuration, this should work without problems, but depending on the server configuration it may not work correctly.
Please check if your item can be obtained from the URL of the item indicated by elFinder on your web server.. @alexantr Thanks! 👍 . @zorn-v Thanks, I'll fix it.. @aaryansaharan This vulnerability has already been reported by Thomas Chauchefoin (Synacktiv), registered as CVE-2019-9194, and has been fixed in elFinder 2.1.48. . The return value is not an array.
. Please correctly implement the function _subdir().
. Is this necessary? In enough elFinderVolumeDriver::createTmb()?
. Can be handled by the stream?
. Please remove 'tmbPath', 'tmbURL' and 'tmpPath'.
. There is a problem if you mounted multiple accounts.
. This is not a good idea. It must set to 2.
. This is not a good idea. It must set to true.
. The file name of the thumbnail seems to overlap when you mount the same name of the path. Also, it seems both thumbnails are deleted when you unmount one of the volume. But I haven't been test. I'm just reading your code.
. This is not good idea. Please remove this line, Or to make detect dirs correctly.
. Value of $stat['dirs'] should be set to 0 if the target directory has not any child directories. Or if it is unknown, it must not be set to the value and it must be set in _subdirs() correctly.
. What kind of problem are you having? Is there a screenshot of the problem?. When I checked, the display position shifts downward due to this change.

. If your amendment is valid for plain elFinder, please make another branch and send it as a separate pull request..

. This is probably wrong \W means "NOT character (a-zA-Z + locale), underscore or digit"
. I suggest /^\w[\w\s\.\-]*$/.
^\w - means it must start with character, digit or underscore.
The other part [\w\s\.\-]* indicates allowed characters letters, digits, underscore, minus and dot
. using \w on my system blocks UTF-8 valid characters like Russian once Новая папка or Arabic مجلد جديد so maybe another solution is just to block files starting with a dot with /^[^\.]/
. Looks like PHP needs special regex flag for correct work with UTF-8. This flag is u, so I suggest default rule for checking valid name should be: /^\w[\w\s\.\-]*$/u this will allow quiet normal file names, maybe we should add brackets to this rule []() as well?

. There is connector option
// open this path on initial request instead of root path
'startPath'       => ''
You can use it to get what you want. This feature is available in elFinder 2.x only
. This is only a start directory somewhere under your root folder. You cannot set this variable directly in the link, but you can write a wrapper in your html/js which will parse your url and grab the path, than on elFinder init you can pass this variable using customData client option. And than in you connector.php you will get this variable in _GET/_POST/_REQUEST and corresponding on that set the startPath.
I have a working example of similar task... probably we need to write a howto about that topic
. This is connector option not a client one: https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/blob/2.x/php/elFinderVolumeDriver.class.php#L153

. That is not something that depends on elfinder, elfinder uses mtime of stat() to get last modification time http://php.net/manual/en/function.stat.php. When you upload a file it is actually created on the server, so creation time (and last modification mtime) is time when it was uploaded and not when file was created on your computer.

@MG73 here is finaly full working example http://jsbin.com/boqeho/14/edit?html,js,output
javascript
$('#elfinder').elfinder({
  url: '//connector-elfinder.rhcloud.com/php/connector.minimal.php',
  // use CodeMirror as external editor
  commandsOptions: {
    edit: {
      //mimes: [],
      editors: [{
        mimes: ['text/plain', 'text/html', 'text/javascript'],
        load: function(textarea) {
          var mimeType = this.file.mime;
          return CodeMirror.fromTextArea(textarea, {
            mode: mimeType,
            lineNumbers: true,
            indentUnit: 4
          });
        },
        save: function(textarea, editor) {
          $(textarea).val(editor.getValue());
        }
      }]
    }
  }
});

. Ошибка связана скорее всего с событиями keypress / keydown.
javascript
// /js/commands/quicklook.js, строка 40
keydown    = $.browser.mozilla || $.browser.opera ? 'keypress' : 'keydown',
Keypress не срабатывает, а если поставить keydown, то все нормально работает
Opera
Версия: 11.50
Сборка: 1074
Платформа: Win32
Система: Windows XP
elFinder последняя git версия
. Нашел в чем причина
При клике на кнопки left / right вызывается
javascript
keydown    = $.browser.mozilla || $.browser.opera ? 'keypress' : 'keydown',
$(document).trigger($.Event(keydown, { keyCode: code, ctrlKey : false, shiftKey : false, altKey : false, metaKey : false }));
т.е. в опере вызывается событие "keypress"
хотя в /js/ui/cwd.js, строка 924 событие на выбор файла вешается на "keydown"
.

Gamerz: If this functionality is added onto the user interface so instead of manually going to the scripts and adding each file/folder to edit we will be able to just edit each individual file/folders on the elFinder file options (right click on a file), then I totally support it to be released for 2.1 . Simple. Just "mount" another set of driver and name it "LocalFileSystem" on your opts inside connector.php Example: ``` php array( array( 'driver' => 'LocalFileSystem', // driver for accessing file system (REQUIRED) 'path' => 'path/to/files/root', // path to files (REQUIRED) 'URL' => 'http://www.localhost.com/files/root/', // URL to files (REQUIRED) 'alias' => 'Root', 'accessControl' => 'access' // disable and hide dot starting files (OPTIONAL) ), array( 'driver' => 'LocalFileSystem', // driver for accessing file system (REQUIRED) 'path' => 'path/to/files/second_root', // path to files (REQUIRED) 'URL' => 'http://www.localhost.com/files/second_root/', // URL to files (REQUIRED) 'alias' => 'Secondary Root', 'accessControl' => 'access' // disable and hide dot starting files (OPTIONAL) ) ) ); `` . Just assign anattributes` array inside the specific mounted driver you would like to set the permissions for. For example, you would like to lock out the "TEST" Folder inside the "Main Root" root, you would do this: php 'LocalFileSystem', // driver for accessing file system (REQUIRED) 'path' => 'path/to/files/main_root', // path to files (REQUIRED) 'accessControl' => 'access', // disable and hide dot starting files (OPTIONAL) 'attributes' => array( array( 'pattern' => '/\TEST$/', //You can also set permissions for file types by adding, for example, .jpg inside pattern. 'read' => false, 'write' => false, 'locked' => true ) ) ), You can set the following true/false to the attributes: 'read' => true/false, 'write' => true/false, 'locked' => true/false, 'hidden' => true/false Hope this helped! . ```
protected function getLocalFile($path)
{
    $local_path = tempnam(sys_get_temp_dir(), 'elfinder');
    if (!$local_path) {
        return false;
    }
$contents = $this->_getContents($path);
if (!$contents) {
    return false;
}

$written = @file_put_contents($local_path, $this->_getContents($path), LOCK_EX);
if ($written !== false) {
    return $local_path;
}

}

. Sorry for the late reply, but this has a few problems with Composer.
You tag, for example, 2.1.1, 2.1.2 etc. This can be required with:
composer require studio-42/elfinder:"2.1.x"
Which is great! But if you have your stability set to dev, you will get the version from the 2.1 branch, which doesn't include a build.
composer require studio-42/elfinder:"2.1.x@dev"
They probably should be reversed, eg. work on 2.1-src and build to 2.1. Or there should be an alias (https://getcomposer.org/doc/articles/aliases.md) but not 100% sure if that works correctly with those branch names.
The main benefit is that a package require elFinder, can just require 2.1.x and don't care about the stability settings.
. Sorry, I don't really understand your question. Could you rephrase that?
composer require studio-42/elfinder:"dev-2.1-src" would probably work indeed, but for example, in laravel-elfinder, I require "studio-42/elfinder": "2.1.x",
If people want the latest nightly, they could require  studio-42/elfinder:"2.1.x@dev" in their own composer file, or lower the stability to dev in the settings. It would still validate as 2.1.x, so will work with my package. But if they need to require dev-2.1-src, it will lead to conflicts.

. ``` mysql
--
-- MySQL 5.5.8
-- Wed, 17 Aug 2011 07:55:27 +0000
--
CREATE TABLE elfinder_file (
   id int(7) unsigned not null auto_increment,
   parent_id int(7) unsigned not null,
   name varchar(256) not null,
   content longblob not null,
   size int(10) unsigned not null default '0',
   mtime int(10) unsigned not null,
   mime varchar(256) not null default 'unknown',
   width int(5) not null,
   height int(5) not null,
   PRIMARY KEY (id),
   UNIQUE KEY (parent_id,name),
   KEY parent_id (parent_id)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 AUTO_INCREMENT=52;
INSERT INTO elfinder_file (id, parent_id, name, content, size, mtime, mime, width, height) VALUES 
('1', '0', 'DATABASE', '', '0', '0', 'directory', '0', '0');

niconphantom:
Это не баг а обычный лимит php судя по логам:
* PHP Warning:  Maximum number of allowable file uploads has been exceeded in Unknown on line 0, 
- Всё можно решить просто добавив в php.ini
max_file_uploads=500 ну или больше если надо )))
- Если возникает ошибка в логах:
* POST Content-Length of ХХХХХХХХ bytes exceeds the limit of 8388608 bytes in Unknown *
То в php.ini нужно изменить post_max_size = 8M На более логичное число, ну и для полного букета убедиться в разумном параметре дтрективы upload_max_filesize.

protected function configure() {
        // set thumbnails path
        //try and fix WEIRD issue when entereing configure function then tmbPath and path is combined as per issue

        if (strpos($this->options['tmbPath'],substr($this->options['path'],0,strlen($this->options['path'])-1).'\') !== FALSE) {  //fix weird value combine bug
            $this->options['tmbPath'] = substr($this->options['tmbPath'],strlen($this->options['path'].'\')-1,strlen($this->options['tmbPath'])); 
        }

Is it possible to disable the remember last opened dir?
. I've found what I think to be a solution for this.
It basically resets the lastDir on init. It is a code hack and does not care about rememberLastDir variable. Hopefully we'll see a fix for this in the coming version.
Within the elfinder.full.js ( or elfinder.min.js ) look for the init
You'll see a code block of
this.trigger('init')
        .request({
            data        : {cmd : 'open', target : self.lastDir(), init : 1, tree : this.ui.tree ? 1 : 0}, 
            preventDone : true,
            notify      : {type : 'open', cnt : 1, hideCnt : true},
            freeze      : true
        })
See where it says self.lastDir() change to to self.lastDir('')

Removed, found a solution. Wrote down my findings here: http://blog.degree.no/2012/10/disable-drag-and-drop-in-elfinder-2-x/
. Hi,
I am experiencing the exact same problem in a .NET port of Elfinder 2.0 rc1. Uploading a file will generate the "Invalid backend response. Data is not JSON." error message in IE8, while in IE9 there is no error but the "Loading" dialog box is never hidden and a page refresh is required to see the uploaded file. 
No exception is thrown in the backend C# code, and the returned JSON is valid. Any suggestions?
Edit: I have found out where the problem starts. In elfinder.js around line 1880 is the upload handling logic for iframe. This is what is used by IE, while Chrome for instance uses the upload handling logic for XMLHttpRequest around line 1970. Could there be a bug here? 
The iframe.contents().text() object which is passed into the parseUploadData() method contains the following:
"The XML page cannot be displayed Cannot view XML input using style sheet. Please correct the error and then click the Refresh button, or try again later. Invalid at the top level of the document. Error processing resource \'http://MyDevelopmentApp/api/connector.ashx\'. Line 1, Posi...{"
This should have been the JSON response returned from the code behind, but instead it seems like it tries to download the connector (.ashx) instead.
. I found the problem. IE8 and IE9 didn't handle Content-Type = "application/json" in the response header.
Wrote a blog post about it, for anyone else with a similar problem: http://blog.degree.no/2012/09/jquery-json-ie8ie9-treats-response-as-downloadable-file/
. I found the problem. IE8 and IE9 didn't handle Content-Type = "application/json" in the response header. 
Wrote a blog post about it, for anyone else with a similar problem: http://blog.degree.no/2012/09/jquery-json-ie8ie9-treats-response-as-downloadable-file/
Please close this issue.
. Finally found the answer, and it was so easy that I am embarrassed when I think about how long it took me to solve it.
Just locate the Draggable options in elFinder.js (around line 465). Remove the appendTo parameter from "body" to "" (empty) and you're done.
Check out this blog post for more details and also how to leave the draggable functionality but stop the actual droppable event: http://blog.degree.no/2012/10/disable-drag-and-drop-in-elfinder-2-x/

. Unless there is good reason the click event for cwd should not stopImmediatePropagation to allow plug-in functionality on file click events.  Changing the code in the click event to stopPropagation has the effect of stopping click events up the chain while still allowing click events on the file elements.
Use case.  Custom api plugin does some updating/preprocessing when a file is selected.  This happens by checking the filesSelected() object in elfinder.  Allowing a click event to be appended to elfinder-cwd element ensures the filesSelected() object is updated before processing.  If stopImmediatePropagation is used then the preprocessing never happens.  However with stopPropagation the preprocessing happens and events do not propagate further up the chain.

Am 28.06.2012 um 14:41 schrieb Troex Nevelin:

Hello, I've seen your email and this pull request. I like idea of unit tests for elFinder but I need to say nobody in our team have ever used PHPUnit, and I hardly understand what you are trying to test. Also PHP code looks very cozy to me and as I understand this intends to run elFinder in browser and test some basic user behaviour? If it is so it's definitely not we want to.
Also PHP is secondary importance language in elFinder, so any build/test code should be written in javascript/nodejs, like your build system.
If someday we would like to write tests for elFinder, they would test first our json API because PHP is only one of many other connectors. I have no idea how we would test js ui, but we probably take a look how it's done in jquery and other major js projects.
Currently we don't have time and manpower to write and maintain unit tests so I can't pull your request.

walmartshopper:
If you are on a windows server, make sure to use backslashes in the 'path' and 'startPath' options.  elFinder checks if 'startPath' is inside the 'path' folder using strpos().  But it adds DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR to the end of 'path'.  If you are on windows and use forward slashes, it would be comparing, for example, '../root\' and '../root/folder' and returning false.  On a linux server I assume it would only work correctly if forward slashes are used.
.

Как только добавляешь composer.json в репозиторий, идешь на packagist, регистрируешь свой модуль/библиотеку, со ссылкой на github. Packagist, считывает данные из репозитория на гитхабе из файла composer.json.
Когда собираешь уже свой проект, пишешь свой файл composer.json в корне проекта и в нем указываешь список необходимых библиотек, которые нашел на том же packagist'e - далее композер это все дело скачивает из разных репов того же гитхаба, собственно мой бандл для симфони2, добавляет поддержку elFinder'a в любой проект на сф2, но тащить файлы elFinder'a в свой реп как-то выглядит нерационально.

inside /application/config/config.php.

scrutari:
This update is for FTP driver only thus the proposed functionality is for Linux only since FTP connector work doesn't work on Windows (see e.g. parseRaw method).
. We are going to propose additional pull request soon with some fixes (including problem with spaces in folder names)
. We are now testing new patch to submit it as new pull request.
The change for line 725 we will revert.
. Chuck, do you have your own implementation of extract/archive functionality in FTP driver?
What platform do you use? our changes are meant to be used on Linux only.
. Our functions rely on supported commands. On Linux we tested tar and zip.
We only plan so far to test our solution on Windows. The current goal is to provide archive/extract functionality on Linux.
One important note about elFinderVolumeFTP::listFilesInDirectory function:
It scans local directory on the FTP server host. The second parameter helps to avoid problems with symlinks in archives.
This function was reworked since our first (now closed) Pull Request #474.
This PR is to replace #474 totally.

Original line:
&& preg_match($regexp, array_shift(explode(';', mime_content_type(__FILE__))))) {

$mime_content_types = explode(';', mime_content_type(__FILE__));

&& preg_match($regexp, array_shift($mime_content_types))

Beanow:
I found a relatively easy fix. In elFinderVolumeLocalFileSystem.class:265 the _stat($path) function should have this extension after if (!file_exists($path)) {return $stat;}.
php
//Verifies the given path is the root or is inside the root. Prevents directory traveral.
if($path !== $this->root && strpos(realpath($path), realpath($this->root).DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR) !== 0){
    return $stat;
}
This prevents files resolving outside the root being detected.
I'll submit a pull request for it.
. @ChuckNorrison I don't think this is safe.
This restricts it by IP. If the user's computer is compromised it breaks. If the same IP is used by many computers (think corporate proxies with 1000's of users on 1 IP) every other computer with that IP can come in. If the script somehow crashes and the file is not deleted the .htaccess may stay there for some time. If more than one admin user accesses the script at the same time the one that visits last locks the other out.
Besides, you can still use your script in combination with my pull-request.
. @ChuckNorrison Well for our solution it's part of a CMS and only intended for the admin panel. So we also needed an additional piece of code in connect.php to validate the user is logged in to our CMS with admin permissions. But there's no harm in the additional security implemented in elFinder. Like when the user's computer is compromised or a sessions is hijacked or the account is compromised by phishing. Still, for your case the most dangerous part is re-using the same IP. School and business networks as well as open hotspots would break an IP filter aproach. Best have another look to see if it is suitable for your setup :]
tl;dr
This pull-request will make elFinder more secure. But you'll still need to take extra precautions based on your setup. Generally IP filters are not strong enough for security.

dkendall:
Nothing seems to have changed. elFinderVolumeMySQL.class.php wasn't calling updateCache directly.
In elFinderVolumeDriver.class.php, function stat calls updateCache, which calls the abstract functions _basename and _dirname.
The elFinderVolumeMySQL.class.php implementations of _basename and _dirname both call stat, which calls updateCache, which calls _basename and _dirname, which both call stat. Etc.

andrew2221:
Hi. The OP's question I think is relevant to all of us, who does need to use the created thumbnails. After some digging, based on ChuckNorrison's suggestion, I found a relatively easy "patch".  So on behalf of everyone who needs this: 
1. search for the function tmbname($stat) in the class elFinderVolumeDriver.class.php
2. replace the return value with this: current(explode('.', $stat['name'])).'.png';
This way the created thumbnails will have the same name as the original image (of course with .png extension).
If that will arise security questions/problems, I don't know. Hope it does help.
. I'm glad it actually helped someone.. :)

This happened to me and it turned to be because I was uploading a file that was larger than PHP was configured to allow. 
To the elfinder team: it would be great if instead of a generic error message, the actual message content returned by jquery (see below) could be reported with it. 
To sunshineboyzxy: Here's how I discovered what happened, if you'd like to see if that's what's happening for you as well:
1. Open elfinder
2. In Chrome, open the Javascript console (View->Developer->Javascript Console)
3. Go to the Network tab
4. Do whatever causes this exception for you
5. A line should appear with a call to elfinder/php/connector.php
6. Click connector.php in the leftmost column. On the right, you should now see the content that the connector sent back, which for me was an HTML-formatted error message.

jranck88:
The issue here is that Bootstrap takes over the button functionality, you can add the following to default back to jQuery UI:
var btn = $.fn.button.noConflict(); // reverts $.fn.button to jqueryui btn
$.fn.btn = btn; // assigns bootstrap button functionality to $.fn.btn
This will change Bootstrap so if you're using button() you'll need to adjust accordingly.

What are the advantages of maintaining Flysystem's drivers here?

It becomes a first-class citizen like the FTP, OneDrive and MySQL drivers.
The advantages are the same for any sufficiently popular driver:
- Better support
- Reduced maintenance load
- Less dependencies and trust required for users..

....

``` php
function access($attr, $path, $data, $volume) {
    if(mime_content_type($path) == / types to show / )
        return null;
    else
        return true;
}

sagikazarmark:
Hi there,
Great work. Just a few comments:
Adapter interface makes it possible to exchange adapters. You can expect the same behaviour. So beyond functional testing I don't know what else you could test. Or maybe I misunderstood what you mean under "testing".
The reasons why you should only accept an object implementing FlysystemInterface are that Flysystem uses a cache for files, also an eventable Flysystem object is available. So accepting both seems a bit weird. IMO type hinting for FlysystemInterface is the official way.

lokothodida:
I would consider taking this a step further and modifying the elFinder source JS files to be modules as well: the main elFinder entry point (elFinder.js) would be written as a UMD module, but the other source files can be AMD/CommonJS/ES6 etc. The major benefit is that regardless of which module system is chosen, Browserify can be used to compile those modules, making the build stage simpler than it currently is. It  would also help to make the dependencies in a given module very explicit, and hopefully allow for current monolithic source files to be broken into smaller, more manageable modules.
. You can do it from the client-side with the onlyMimes property:
javascript
$('.elfinder').elfinder({
  // ...
  onlyMimes: ['image'], // restricts to images
  // ...
});
. Here is a cleaned up version of the elfinder.src.html file that you or others might find useful.
. What is the reason for preventing confirmation dialogs from appearing? It seems a bit dangerous from a UI perspective to prevent the user from stopping accidental actions.
. Ok. How have you added the external actions?
. So I haven't tried this yet, but you might want to give it a shot.
The js/commands/rm.js file defines the delete command for the front-end. It has some code in it that triggers the dialog.
So if you're willing to modify the core just for your own project, you can remove/comment out the fm.confirm(/* */) stuff and replace it with what is defined on the accept callback. This would remove the confirmation dialog any time a file is deleted.
I can think of a way that this could be added to the core with a configuration parameter on elFinder, but I'm not too sure if its a feature that the developers would want.
. Or (and this too is untested), so you don't change the functionality of the normal rm action, you can copy the rm.js file (removing the confirm dialog section) and give the command a unique name:
javascript
// rmcustom.js
elFinder.prototype.commands.rmcustom = function() {
  // ...
};
Load that script after the elFinder core has loaded:
html
<!-- elfinder core, then: -->
<script src="js/commands/rmcustom.js"></script>
Add that command to the elfinder configuration
javascript
  commands: [ /* your basic commands, then: */ 'rmcustom' ]
Then use the elfinder instance to execute your new command
``` javascript
var instance = $('.elfinder').elfinder('instance');
// ...
var myCustomCallback = function() {
  var hashes = / get the hashes for the files that need to be deleted /;
  instance.exec('rmcustom', hashes);
};
```
Running myCustomCallback when you need to (I'm guessing it's on a click event?).
I'm not sure of the best way to get the hashes, though. In terms of the client event callbacks, the select callback has an array of the currently selected files on the event parameter (event.data.selected), so you may need to use that callback to set the data somewhere, then get that data in your custom callback.
. I know what you mean.

  // 'delete' action
  rm: {
    // disable the confirmation dialog
    dialog: false
  }
}

As for advice for simple edits to any Github project: if you are certain that you are making changes that will not break the project (i.e. the changes require little to no testing), you can edit files directly off of Github (without needing to install anything on your local machine). By clicking on a file and then clicking the pencil icon in the top right corner of it you can edit the file:

or by clicking on the + near the top of the current directory's breadcrumb trail, you can create a new file in that directory:

This will automatically create a new fork of the project in a repository under your own account, and you can make all of the changes that you want there:

Then once you are finished, you create a pull request.

. Just putting out a sketch of how it could be implemented in a future release (without having looked too hard at the PHP connector), since there hasn't been much of a discussion on how to do this with 2.x+'s multi-root volumes:
- Have a local temp/trash directory that holds information about deleted files
  - For local file systems its easiest to just have the the folders/files themselves, but for other volumes it is probably best to store pseudo-information about the file/directory
- Have a volume "Recycle Bin" that points to said temp/trash directory
- Have the immediate sub-volumes/directories of the "Recycle Bin" volume correspond to the main volumes, e.g.
- Volume 1
- Volume 2
- Volume 3
- Recycle Bin
  - Volume 1
  - Volume 2
  - Volume 3
- Implement the connectors for each of the main volumes such that they have a "Recycle" action, which sends the appropriate amount of information to corresponding sub-volume in the temp/trash directory
- Also implement a "Restore From" action for each connector, which takes information about a deleted file/directory and restores it in that volume
- Then implement the "Recycle Bin" connector so that it has a "restore" action, which takes information about a given file and its volume and executes the "Restore From" action on that volume
. Thanks for responding so promptly :+1:

fauri13:
There are no errors at all in the connector. The post request never reaches the server. I have iptables configured but don't see either that the connection is blocked.
It's like the javascript enters an infinite loop... It starts to use huge amounts of CPU time and memory.
. Found the problem!
The connector sends to the client the value of upload_max_filesize in the php.ini. If it is set to 0, the uplMaxSize variable is set to "0" (as string, not numeric) and when getting the BYTES_PER_CHUNK, the or between "0" and a number, it returns "0". So 0 minus 8190 is negative and thus it enters an infinite loop.
Pulled the fix if you want to check it.
. Changed the returnBytes funct so it always returns an integer (it was returning an string when val = "0").
I think it's a better solution than the first I made.
.

mleko64:
Hello!
I have the same problem and I confirm this issue.
This is my solution (in elFinderVolumeLocalFileSystem.class.php file):
Comment out this line: 
$match = glob(rtrim($path, DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR) . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . '*'.$_q.'*', GLOB_NOSORT);
Add this lines:
$files = glob(rtrim($path, DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR) . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . '*', GLOB_NOSORT);
$match = array();
foreach($files as $file) {
    if(preg_match('/'.$_q.'/i', basename($file))) {
        $match[] = $file;
    }
}
I found also another issue (connected with search engine).
If you type something in search input and choose "All" location then you get "Error backend response". Problem is in elFinder.class.php file (line 2098, method "search"). There is a bug in this if-statment:
if (!is_null($target)
$target variable is a string with "null" value. My solution change this line
if (!is_null($target)
to this line:
if (!is_null($target) && $target != 'null')
I hope that helped :)

flack:
One way around this might be to use the cancel option instead of the filter option: 
http://api.jqueryui.com/selectable/#option-cancel
The difference is that with cancel, the click event still gets triggered
. @nao-pon filter only removes non-matching items from the resultset, i.e. you can still start to select on a filtered element (i.e. the mouse click is captures). cancel prevents selectable from activating when you click on an element matching the configured selector, so other event listeners get a chance to act.
But restoring delay works for me, too. 
BTW: I've noticed that selection stops working when you sort (at least in list view). Should I open another ticket for that?
. I'm on PHP 5.3.3 (Debian 6) and I'm using a custom adapter (extends elFinderVolumeDriver, source is available here: https://github.com/flack/openpsa/blob/master/lib/org/openpsa/documents/elFinderVolumeOpenpsa.php), so maybe this has something to do with it. But it worked fine since at least 2.1.8, until 2.1.16 (2.1.17 doesn't run at all on PHP 5.3, so I don't know if this would also exhibit the problem). Thanks for looking into the issue!
I've tried removing the midcom::get()->finish(); line, and also completely removing the shutdown function, but the warning still appears . I've bisected the issue now, and it looks like it comes from this commit: 7b8053a3bac1b3602830a04ade5a1f0150b708c1. I've tried setting noSessionCache for the volume, but it didn't help. The problem goes away however when I remove this line: https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/blob/master/php/elFinderVolumeDriver.class.php#L675. Yes, that gets rid of the warning. BTW, I've looked a bit around, and I think this may only on PHP 5.3 because of this line:
https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/blob/master/php/elFinderSession.php#L41
Since I instantiate elFinder from inside my framework, there is already a session running (based on Symfony HTTPFoundation). So my guess would be that in php 5.4+, elFinder detects the running session and doesn't try to start, while on 5.3, session_start() gets called a prints the warning. So another possible workaround would be to change this line:
https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/blob/master/php/elFinderSession.php#L47
to look like this:
php
    @session_start();. I think I've found a cleaner solution now than suppressing error output and sent a pull request. @nao-pon looks good!. Looks good, thanks!. @nao-pon is there any special configuration option you have to set to get the additional CSS classes? I just tried this in two different elFinder integrations, and the buttons in the dialog only have CSS classes like this: ui-button ui-widget ui-state-default ui-corner-all ui-button-text-only elfinder-btncnt-3 elfinder-tabstop. I can see the classes in your demo site, but I don't see them in my own setups (e.g. here: http://demo.openpsa2.org/documents/). Tested with jquery UI 1.11.4 and 1.12.1. P.S.: I've also tried with the bundled elfinder.html (no modifications made), and this also only gives me elfinder-btncnt-3 and so on, not semantic classnames like elfinder-confirm-btn-rename. ah, ok, sorry, I didn't see that this was closed via a commit. Thanks @nao-pon !. @nao-pon I tried commenting out all the ini_set calls, but it doesn't make a difference. The thing is, it's some sort of memory corruption AFAICT. For example, it says charset 'p-honorific-suffix', then I reload, and the error becomes charset '�'. The line that triggers the error in my code looks like this:
php
            $string .= ' ' . $key . '="' . htmlspecialchars($val, ENT_COMPAT) . '"';
So I don't set the third parameter either. @nao-pon I have debugged some more, and it is a bit hard to be sure, because sometimes the corruption stays until you restart apache, but I'm now relatively sure that the problem is caused by 
php
ini_set('internal_encoding', 'UTF-8');
At least, if I comment out this line on the latest release and restart Apache, I can't seem to reproduce any longer. This might be related: https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=71876. ini_set('mbstring.internal_encoding', ''); throws a deprecated error on PHP 7.1, but I don't see the corruption problem with these three. @nao-pon I tested shortly and so far, it looks good. . Files mime types are checked at the server, so try to change the mimeDetect connector option (https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/wiki/Connector-configuration-options-2.1#mimedetect).
Today i had similar problem, when onlyMimes set to text/css didn't work as expected (filtered out css-files that should not).
The problem was at the server side: mime types was determined incorrectly. I changed mimeDetect connector option to internal and it solves the problem (on Windows, didn't check it at *nix yet).
You can see what mime types server set for each file by looking into server response. It is the first place where i had started from to find the reason of the problem.
. @canbozdemir, mimeDetect option is connector option (under root key) and should be set on server side, not in javascript. In my case mimeDetect by default was set to finfo and it caused to incorrect mime types for some files. After setting it to internal my problem was resolved. Just try.
Look at documentation: https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/wiki/Connector-configuration-options-2.1#mimeDetect.
. @canbozdemir, sorry i'm not familiar with ASP.NET. In my case with backend on PHP mimeDetect option worked out my issue with mime types. For example, without changing this option, by default for css-files server determined mime-types differently: for some css-files it was text/x-c++, for some correct text/css. This issue is all about server. Client just tells a server that it should respond only with files that match specified mime-types.If server determines mime-types wrong — client will recive wrong files list.
Whait for @nao-pon, maby he clarify about ASP.NET.
. @canbozdemir, nothing bro :)
Wait for @nao-pon, he can tell you more than I.
. @canbozdemir, so, at first place you should discover how your server determines files' mime-types.
Maybe there is some similar server option, like mimeDetect. I never worked with ASP.NET, I even didn't know that such elFinder version exists until today :)
. @nao-pon, wow, these changes fully covers my and other's needs, thank you again!

                               $this->disabled[] ='chmod';
               }

```
Solution :  changed the option in connector.php to use statOwner.
2)     elfinder.src.html  contains no link to file js/commands/chmod.js ,
Solution : loaded this file
Now the button appears in toolbar, but remains disabled.
3)     js/commands/chmod.js , line  53, in function this.getstate contains statement
self.checkstate(this.files(sel), this cause error in javascript console : “self.checkstate is no function” , Chrome 51
Solution : change self.checkstate to this.checkstate.
The error disappears, but button is still disabled.
4)     this.checkstate has returned false, cause statement return (f.isowner && f.perm && isPerm(f.perm) && (cnt == 1 || f.mime != 'directory')) ? f : null;
returns null. Reason is that f.isowner is false, caused by undefined function posix_getuid() , missingPHP module posix.
Solution : Installed module php-posix.
Now chmod apparently works.
Thanks for Your hints , it would be nice if You could check whether the things I found are really bugs and incorporate the changes in the actual release
Best regards Gerhard

I find on internet that many person have such problem in another frameworks. 
Then I edit my elFinderVolumeDriverClass.php and after this:
'docx:application/zip' => 'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document',
'xlsx:application/zip' => 'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet xlsx',
pptx:application/zip' => 'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation',
add this:
'docx:application/octet-stream' => 'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document',
'xlsx:application/octet-stream'=> 'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet xlsx',
'pptx:application/octet-stream' => 'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation'      
I found another solution maybe good for future of ElFinder to be sure that in all version of php always every extension work the same. It not base of php magic.mime files , but  based of apache mime type definition file which is easy to download and parse.
For example (in example mime.type downloaded file, but it can be local file distributed with ElFinder, and update with update sometimes with ElFinder update)
function generateUpToDateMimeArray($url){
    $return = array();
    $mimes = file_get_contents('http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/httpd/httpd/trunk/docs/conf/mime.types'); 
    preg_match_all('#^([^\s]{2,}?)\s+(.+?)$#ism', $mimes, $matches, PREG_SET_ORDER);  
    foreach ($matches as $match){
        $exts = split(" ", $match[2]);
        foreach ($exts as $ext){
            $return[$ext]=$match[1];
        }
    }
    return $return;
}
// usage:
$typeMime = generateUpToDateMimeArray();
echo $typeMime['gif'];

. Ok, that seems to work, although I don't really like the fact that it shows the published link in the new window's URL.
Is there a way to make it open the file in a new tab, instead of a new window?. Ok, that seems to work, although I don't really like the fact that it shows the published link in the new window's URL.
Is there a way to make it open the file in a new tab, instead of a new window?. After some more research, it looks like this is happening on line 892 of elFinderVolumeDropbox.class.php. It's using the /shares endpoint of the Dropbox API, which creates a permanent share link. At an absolute minimum, it should be using the /media endpoint instead, which creates a link that is good for 4 hours. Although even for the /media endpoint, the documentation explicitly states:

This URL should not be used to display content directly in the browser.

And that's for the reasons that I mentioned in the OP (anyone sniffing the connection could see a request to that URL and visit it themselves). I think the only real solution is to either:
1) instead of using the /shares API endpoint to view the file, get the file contents internally using the /files (GET) endpoint, then output it in its entirety to the browser, OR
2) use the /media endpoint to create a temporary link to the file, then stream the contents to the browser through the connector file
I think these are the only ways you will have any real security here.. Thanks, I understand now. Is there a way to use a pre-existing API token though, instead of having to register it?. After looking at the source code, I see that in the client configuration you can specify a "soundpath" option, which fixed the issue when I set it as the actual path of the sound files. This configuration option is not listed in the Wiki for the Client Configuration Options though, so you may want to add that.. I'm using the "upload.pre" callback function to encrypt the file before it is sent to Dropbox. Since it's using base64 encoding after the encryption, the size of the file sent to Dropbox is notably larger than the size of the file that the user was trying to upload. Is there no way to override this check for this kind of use case? I thought that's what the point of the "upload.pre" callback was for..

mparoni55: Figured out the root cause of this issue: we were using it with WHMCS (thus had included the WHMCS init.php file in the custom connector file), and apparently WHMCS auto encodes all POST data as html encoding.  So all the special html characters are encoded automatically.   Removing the init.php file inclusion from the connector file fixed the issue.   .

I'm sorry to re-open this post, but I have the same problem today and don't know how to fix it
you can see it in this page : 
http://dbtech.di67.fr/elfinder.html
Click to the search field and type something..

Can you help me to know why I have this problem ?
Thx !. Thank you for answering, but i putten the line in wrong place, if I put it after all Js files include, it works better without any error, but still not the text field arround.
But I've a clue for this problem : 
I noticed that each key which doesn't work in arround text field is in reallity a Shortcut for ElFinder usage !
Like, "backspace" is a shortcut for browse the parent directory !
The "F5" (refresh button which doesn't work anymore) refresh in reallity the inside of ElFinder !!
"Space" is for open file like in Mac Os ....
So this probleme is not really a probleme ! It's juste because ElFinder Capture my Shortcut and use it for itselfes functionnalities !! 
So how can I disable this functionalities ?. I found the solution !
in main.js just add  "allowShortcuts: false" here :
opts = {
    url : './templates/v4/assets/elfinder/php/connector.minimal.php', // connector URL (REQUIRED)
    lang: lang,                         // auto detected language (optional)
    allowShortcuts: false
},
And it works ! 
Thank you !.

ioaoue:
I tested some versions from 2.1 branch including 2.1.12, 2.1.13, 2.1.20, 2.1.25 and the latest commit. Version 2.1.12 works correctly, and 2.1.13 do not. Then I did git bisect and found that d5ce45b is the first commit with this problem.
I looked at requests from elFinder client to connector and found that on https://studio-42.github.io/elFinder/ every file upload consists of 2 requests: "ls" and then "upload" commands. But on my server only the first file upload looks like that (and the first file uploads correctly). All subsequent uploads conist of 4 requests:
1. cmd=ls
   target=A_L3Rlc3Q_E
   intersect[]=1C
1. cmd=open
   reload=1
   target=A_L3Rlc3Q_E
   tree=1
   compare
1. cmd=ls
   target=A_L3Rlc3Q_E
   intersect[]=1C
1. ```
   -----------------------------148555191713858134561052379747
   Content-Disposition: form-data; name="cmd"
upload
   -----------------------------148555191713858134561052379747
   Content-Disposition: form-data; name="target"
A_L3Rlc3Q_E
   -----------------------------148555191713858134561052379747
   Content-Disposition: form-data; name="upload[]"; filename="1C"
   Content-Type: application/octet-stream
-----------------------------148555191713858134561052379747
   Content-Disposition: form-data; name="mtime[]"
1499745991
   -----------------------------148555191713858134561052379747
   Content-Disposition: form-data; name="upload_path[]"
A_L3Rlc3Q_E
   -----------------------------148555191713858134561052379747
   Content-Disposition: form-data; name="dropWith"
0
   -----------------------------148555191713858134561052379747--
   ```
And "open" request lasts much longer than subsequent "ls" and "upload". I think there could be some issue with asynchronous handling of responses.
1. Upload works fine and the file appears in the view.
1. ElFinder client handles response to the "open" command. This command was sent before the "upload" command, and the response does not contain new files.
1. ElFinder client updates the view and uploaded files disappear.
So I have 2 questions:
1. Why elFinder client sends "open" command to server? Maybe I should set some client options, or maybe connector sends incorrect response to the first "open" command (with "init" flag set)?
1. Why elFinder client sends "ls" and "upload" commands before it recieves response to the "open" command? Maybe I do something wrong?. For now elFinder do not send the open command. Only ls, then upload. All works correctly.. > If the uploading file name is exists in results of ls and CWD does not have that file, elFinder will request the open command and try to keep the CWD up to date.
For now I do not see this behavior. I tried:
1. Clear the folder
1. Create a file in that folder from server console
1. Upload a file into that folder with the same name
ElFinder client sent only 2 requests: ls and upload.. Did the same test on 2.1.25:
1. 1st ls request
1. 1st ls response
1. open request
1. 2nd ls request
1. 2nd ls response
1. upload request
1. upload response
1. open response. Captured full conversations for 2 cases:
- subsequent upload of files A and B into empty directory /test
2.1.25_upload_ab.txt
2.1.latest_upload_ab.txt
- upload of file A when it is present on the server, but client does not know about that
  2.1.25_upload_existing.txt
2.1.latest_upload_existing.txt
Now I see at least one bug in the connector: it seems that it does not understand intersect parameter of the ls command.
. I modified response from connector to match this format. Now ElFinder client works as expected. I think this issue could be closed.
Please update the wiki if there are some other errors in API description..

 'mtime' => '0',
 'mime' => 'directory',
 'read' => '1',
 'write' => '1',
 'locked' => '0',
 'hidden' => '0',
 'width' => '0',
 'height' => '0')
);

Still no luck.. No result. Get a SQL error. Here's the $sql  generated:
SELECT f.id, f.parent_id, f.name, f.size, f.mtime AS ts, f.mime, f.read, f.write, f.locked, f.hidden, f.width, f.height, IF(ch.id, 1, 0) AS dirs 
FROM elfinder_file AS f 
LEFT JOIN elfinder_file AS p ON p.id=f.parent_id 
LEFT JOIN elfinder_file AS ch ON ch.parent_id=f.id 
  AND ch.mime='directory' 
WHERE f.id='1' 
GROUP BY f.id

I ran this in phpMyAdmin and I get this Error:

1055 - Expression #13 of SELECT list is not in GROUP BY clause and contains nonaggregated column 'elfinder.ch.id' which is not functionally dependent on columns in GROUP BY clause; this is incompatible with sql_mode=only_full_group_by

. This fixed by adding ch.id to the GROUP BY clause.

GROUP BY f.id, ch.id

NOW I can see the DATEBASE tree. Great !
Apparently ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY became standard in version 5.7.5

MySQL 5.7.5 and up implements detection of functional dependence. If the ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY SQL mode is enabled (which it is by default), MySQL rejects queries for which the select list, HAVING condition, or ORDER BY list refer to nonaggregated columns that are neither named in the GROUP BY clause nor are functionally dependent on them. (Before 5.7.5, MySQL does not detect functional dependency and ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY is not enabled by default. For a description of pre-5.7.5 behavior, see the MySQL 5.6 Reference Manual.)
. NOTE there are several other GROUP BY clauses with the same problem. Better check them all.
Like Line 235.

I was finally able to debug this issue.
It seems that the bottleneck is to detect the mimetype. In particular, finfo_file takes about 30ms per file, which is huge when I have hundreds of files.

enlivenapp:
I'm using PHP 7.1.8 and have a similar issue on dev and production servers.
ini_set(): Use of iconv.internal_encoding is deprecated
Filename: php/elFinder.class.php
Line Number: 464

and 
Message: ini_set(): Use of mbstring.internal_encoding is deprecated
Filename: php/elFinder.class.php
Line Number: 467

If these two things are depreciated in PHP 5.6+, why are you specifically checking for PHP >= 5.6 to set them?  Wouldn't you want to remove them altogether or check for lower versions and not bother with any higher version?
below makes elfinder usable, as does commenting out both ini_set()s.
if (version_compare(PHP_VERSION, '5.6', '<')) {

Additionally, the latests elfinder release (2.1.35) gives me this error:
http://requirejs.org/docs/errors.html#scripterror

. @nao-pon,
Because they have a value does not mean they are set in php.ini! I understand you're invalidating them, my problem is first, iconv.internal_encoding is not even present in my .ini, and second mbstring.internal_encoding is commented out which means they're being set by the default_charset value which defaults to UTF-8.  See below.
According to PHP (http://php.net/manual/en/iconv.configuration.php)
PHP 5.6 and later users should leave this empty and set default_charset instead.

So why not leave iconv.internal_encoding or mbstring.internal_encoding alone (since they cause depreciation errors and the PHP group says to do so) and deal with it through default_charset which defaults to UTF-8
http://php.net/manual/en/ini.core.php#ini.default-charset
default_charset string
In PHP 5.6 onwards, "UTF-8" is the default value and its value is used as the default character
encoding for htmlentities(), html_entity_decode() and htmlspecialchars() if the encoding parameter
is omitted. The value of default_charset will also be used to set the default character set for iconv
functions if the iconv.input_encoding, iconv.output_encoding and iconv.internal_encoding 
configuration options are unset, and for mbstring functions if the mbstring.http_input
mbstring.http_output mbstring.internal_encoding configuration option is unset.
...
internal_encoding string
Available from PHP 5.6.0. This setting is used for multibyte modules such as 
mbstring and iconv. Default is empty. If empty, default_charset is used.

I should note, when setting ENV = production, the errors disappear (as one would expect) and elFinder runs without issues. (v2.1.34). @nao-pon

Much easier. This happens in Firefox and you can move the selected file or the "connector.minimal.php" that appears sometimes but always with size 0 bytes.
In Chrome, drag & drop with caps key between directories has no effect.
. Holding down the Alt key, Ctrl key, Caps key (uppercase key), they are normal gestures that are used for operations with files (copy, move, ... etc).
I have done some tests with the following results:


When you drag a file from outside of elfinder (i.e. from the client's file explorer to an elfinder directory)
-> the behavior is normal in all browsers (upload the file)


When you drag a file from within elfinder (i.e. from one directory of elfinder to another)

drag + alt key
Firefox : causes the "upload" of a defective file to the destination directory (*)
Chrome : idem (*)
Safari : idem (*)
drag + uppercase key
Firefox : causes the "upload" of a defective file to the destination directory (*)
Chrome : the drag does not occur, has no effect
Safari : the drag does not occur, has no effect
drag + Ctrl key
Firefox copy the file correctly
Chrome copy the file correctly
Safari copy the file correctly



Development and test environment :

Server    
Debian 9 + Apache 2.4 + MySQL 5.7 + PHP 5.6 (all updated)
I have created a new virtual host and I have put a clean, untouched copy of elfinder Versión: 2.1.48 (2.1-src Nightly: 802a690)
I have changed in the file "connector.minimal.php" :
'uploadDeny'  => array('all'),   ---------->   'uploadDeny' => array(''),
'uploadAllow' => array('image/x-ms-bmp', ...etc),   ---------->   'uploadAllow' => array('all'),


Clients
Windows 7 Professional + Firefox Quantum 65.0.2 + Google Chrome Versión 72.0.3626.121 (Build oficial)
Mac OSX El Capitan + Safari 11.1
